title: Anyone recognise this font?
content:
Hi there - im new to the ’font’ world, but am starting to gain interest.  
I build websites on the side - and I was wondering if anyone could tell me the font [http://similicio.us](http://web.archive.org/web/20071227152901/http:/similicio.us/ "http://similicio.us") uses as there logo font. I love the clean simple look - love the ’u’.

Thanks in advance  
~Andy

 [‹ care to suggest a typeface?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071227152901/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37051 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font too small for screen? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071227152901/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36957 "Go to next forum topic")
author: andyhowes

comments.content:
Hi Andy,

Often you can find the a font name by checking the source code of the website. That font is [Century Gothic.](http://web.archive.org/web/20071227152901/http:/www.linotype.com/147488/centurygothic-family.html)

Eileen
And if Century Gothic is not installed on his machine, then he would be seeing Trebuchet.

True - and if no Trebuchet, then Arial Narrow and so on down the code:

_font-family:”Century Gothic”, “Trebuchet MS”, “Arial Narrow”, Arial, sans-serif;_

It’s also not a logo, by the way, but that’s a whole different discussion.

Eileen

[Eileen Burke Graphic Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20071227152901/http:/www.eileenburke.org/)

Thank you!!!  
Great help, and I know about the view-source code - just not how to find the style sheet code that referenced???  
Regards,  
~Andy

It’s easy. The source code on similicio.us references a css style sheet in this line:

_link href=”sim.css” rel=”stylesheet” type=”text/css”_

So, simply add sim.css to the end of the url, like this:

_http://similicio.us/sim.css_

Then, find the “h1” style attributed to the font you’re looking for.

Viola!

[Eileen Burke Graphic Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20071227152901/http:/www.eileenburke.org/)

Thank you for all your help - very much appreciated! And I learned something new!!  
~Andy
